intro: Thyrsanthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered thyrsanthus, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clustered inflorescences, which are borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and often have a reddish or purplish hue when young. Thyrsanthus parviflorus is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils and sunny conditions.
